metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9742 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Miller-Rabin primality check in Botan before 1.10.8 and 1.11.x before 1.11.9 improperly uses a single random base, which makes it easier for remote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via a DH group.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbotan-1.10-0 - 1.10.5-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: botan1.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.5-1+deb7u1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
